data.title: heads of state
data.text:
years image name(s), birth- and death data and political party title and reign

In 1095 Henri de Bourgogne (Henry of Burgundy) is assigned the county belonging to Galicia, from which 44 years later the Kingdom of Portugal arises.

The counts and since 1139 kings of the House of Burgundy up to and including the succession crisis (1383-1385): 1095-1112 Henrique, born Henri de Bourgogne in 1066 in Dijon, France and died on 24 April 1112 in Astorga, Spain, about 45 years old. Count of Portugal:

1095 - 24-04-1112 1112-1128 Teresa AfÃ³nses, Countess de LÃ©on, born in 1080 in PÃ³voa de Lanhoso and died on 11 November 1130 in Montederramo, Spain, about 50 years old. Countess :

24-04-1112 - 24-06-1128 1128-1185 Count Afonso Henriques, since 1139 king Afonso I 'o Conquistador' (the Conqueror), 'o Fundador' (the Founder) en 'o Grande' (the Great), born in 1106, on 25 July 1109, in August 1109 or in 1111 in Coimbra, GuimarÃ£es or Viseu and died on 6 December 1185 in Coimbra, 73 to 79 years old. Count:

24-06-1128 - 27-07-1139

King of Portugal:

27-07-1139 - 06-12-1185 1185-1211 Sancho I 'o Povoador' (the Populator), born on 11 November 1154 in Coimbra and died on 26 March 1211 in Coimbra, 56 years old. King:

06-12-1185 - 26-03-1211 1211-1223 Afonso II 'o Gordo' (the Fat), born on 23 April 1185 in Coimbra and died on 25 March 1223 in Coimbra, 37 years old. King:

26-03-1211 - 25-03-1223 1223-1248 Sancho II 'o Piedoso' (the Pious) en 'o Capelo' (the Cowled), born on 8 September 1209 in Coimbra and died on 4 January 1248 in Toledo, Spain, 38 years old. King:

25-03-1223 - 04-01-1248

(on 24-07-1246 declared deposed by the pope) 1245-1248

1248-1279 Afonso III 'o Restaurador' (the Restorer), Count de Boulogne, born on 5 May 1210 in Coimbra and died on 16 February 1279 in Lisbon, 68 years old. Regent for Sancho II:

21-09-1245 - 04-01-1248

King:

04-01-1248 - 16-02-1279 1279-1325 Dinis I 'o Lavrador' (the Farmer) en 'o Poeta' (the Poet), born on 9 October 1261 in Lisbon and died on 7 January 1325 in SantarÃ©m, 61 years old. King:

16-02-1279 - 07-01-1325 1325-1357 Afonso IV 'o Bravo' (the Good), born on 8 February 1291 in Lisbon and died on 28 May 1357 in Lisbon, 66 years old. King:

07-01-1325 - 28-05-1357 1357-1367 Pedro I 'o Cruel' (the Druel) en 'o Justiceiro' (the Just), born on 8 April 1320 in Coimbra and died on 18 January 1367 in Estremoz, 46 years old. King:

28-05-1357 - 18-01-1367 1367-1383 Fernando I 'o Formoso' (the Fair), born on 31 October 1345 in Coimbra and died on 22 October 1383 in Lisbon, 37 years old. King:

18-01-1367 - 22-10-1383 1383-1385 Beatriz, born between 7 and 13 February 1373 in Coimbra and died probably in June 1420 in Toro, Spain, 47 years old. Queen during the interregnum 1383-1385 (disputed):

22-10-1383 - 06-04-1385 1383-1384 Leonor Telles de Menezes, born in 1350 in TrÃ¡s-os-Montes and died on 27 April 1386 in Tordesillas, Spain, about 35 years old. Regent for Beatriz:

22-10-1383 - 13-01-1384 1383-1385 JoÃ£o de Avis, born on 11 April 1357 in Lisbon and died on 14 August 1433 in Lisbon, 76 years old. Regent for Beatriz:

16-12-1383 - 06-04-1385 1384-1385 Juan I, king of Castille, born on 24 August 1358 in Ãpila, Spain and died on 9 October 1390 in AlcalÃ¡ de Henares, Spain, 32 years old. King in rebellion against Beatriz:

13-01-1384 - 06-04-1385

In 1385 Beatriz her uncle and regent JoÃ£o de Aviz becomes king of Portugal after a succession crisis of one and a half years. He becomes the first king of the House of Aviz, who reigns until 1580: 1385-1433 JoÃ£o I de Avis 'o de Boa MemÃ³ria' (with the Good Memory), born on 11 April 1357 in Lisbon and died on 14 August 1433 in Lisbon, 76 years old. King:

06-04-1385 - 14-08-1433 1385 Juan I, king of Castille, born on 24 August 1358 in Ãpila, Spain and died on 9 October 1390 in AlcalÃ¡ de Henares, Spain, 32 years old. King in rebellion against JoÃ£o I:

06-04-1385 - 14-08-1385 1433-1438 Duarte 'o EloqÃ¼ente' (the Eloquent), born on 31 October 1391 in Viseu and died on 9 September 1438 in Tomar, 46 years old. King:

14-08-1433 - 09-09-1438 1438-1481 Afonso V 'o Africano' (the African), born on 15 January 1432 in Sintra and died on 28 August 1481 in Lisbon, 49 years old. King:

09-09-1438 - 28-08-1481 1438-1440 Leonor de AragÃ£o, born on 1 February 1402 in Medina del Campo, Spain and died on 19 February 1445 in Toledo, Spain, 43 years old. Regent for Afonso V:

10-09-1438 - 31-10-1440 1438-1448 Pedro de Portugal, Count de Coimbra, born on 9 December 1392 in Lisbon and died on 22 May 1449 in Alverca, 56 years old. Regent for Afonso V:

09-09-1438 - 11-07-1448 1481-1495 JoÃ£o II 'o PrÃ­ncipe Perfeito' (the Perfect Prince), born on 3 March 1455 in Lisbon and died on 25 October 1495 in Alvor, 40 years old. King:

28-08-1481 - 25-10-1495 1495-1521 Manuel I 'o Venturoso' (the Fortunate), born on 31 May 1469 in Alcochete and died on 13 December 1521 in Lisbon, 52 years old. King:

25-10-1495 - 13-12-1521 1521-1557 JoÃ£o III 'o Piedoso' (the Pious), born on 7 June 1502 in Lisbon and died on 11 June 1557 in Lisbon, 55 years old. King:

13-12-1521 - 11-06-1557 1557-1578 SebastiÃ£o I 'o Desejado' (the Desired), born on 20 January 1554 in Lisbon and died on 4 August 1578 in AlcÃ¡cer-Quibir, Morocco, 24 years old. King:

11-06-1557 - 04-08-1578 1557-1562 Catarina de Austria, born on 14 January 1507 in Torquemada, Spain and died on 12 February 1578 in Lisbon, 71 years old. Regent for SebastiÃ£o I:

11-06-1557 - 12-12-1562 1557-1568 Cardinal Henrique, Prince of Portugal, Archbishop of Lisbon, born on 31 January 1512 in Lisbon and died on 31 January 1580 in Almeirim, 68 years old. Regent for SebastiÃ£o I:

11-06-1557 - 20-01-1568 Jorge de Almeida, Archbishop of Lisbon, born in 1531 in Lisbon and died on 20 March 1585 in Torres Novas, about 53 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

04-08-1578 - 24-08-1578 Pedro de AlcÃ¡Ã§ova Carneiro, Count de Idanhas, born on 29 June 1515 in Lisbon and died on 12 May 1593, 77 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

04-08-1578 - 24-08-1578 1578 Francisco de SÃ¡ de Meneses, Count de Sever e Matosinhos, heer de SÃ£o JoÃ£o de Foz, born about 1510 in Porto and died about 1583, about 73 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

04-08-1578 - 24-08-1578 JoÃ£o de Mascarenhas, born about 1520 and died in 1580, about 60 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

04-08-1578 - 24-08-1578 1578-1580 Henrique I 'o Casto' (the Chaste) en 'o Cardinal-Rei' (the Cardinal-King), Archbishop of Lisbon, born on 31 January 1512 in Lisbon and died on 31 January 1580 in Almeirim, 68 years old. King:

24-08-1578 - 31-01-1580 Jorge de Almeida, Archbishop of Lisbon, born in 1531 in Lisbon and died on 20 March 1585 in Torres Novas, about 53 years old. Governor and Defender of the Kingdom:

31-01-1580 - 17-07-1580 Francisco de SÃ¡ de Meneses, Count de Sever e Matosinhos, Lord de SÃ£o JoÃ£o de Foz, born about 1510 in Porto and died about 1583, about 73 years old. Governor and Defender of the Kingdom:

31-01-1580 - 17-07-1580 1580 JoÃ£o Telo de Meneses, Archbishop of Lisbon, born in 15?? and died in 1580. Governor and Defender of the Kingdom:

31-01-1580 - 17-07-1580 JoÃ£o de Mascarenhas, born about 1520 and died in 1580, about 60 years old. Governor and Defender of the Kingdom:

31-01-1580 - 17-07-1580 Diogo Lopes de Sousa, Lord de Oliveira do Bairro, born about 1510 and died in 1580, about 70 years old. Governor and Defender of the Kingdom:

31-01-1580 - 17-07-1580 1580 AntÃ³nio I, Prior of Crato, born in 1531 in Lisbon and died on 26 August 1595 in Paris, France, about 64 years old. King in dissidence against the Governors:

19-06-1580 - 17-07-1580

From 1578-1580 problems arise again with regard to the succession to the throne and Spain seizes his chance to proclaim its monarch as King of Portugal, resulting in the Iberian Union in 1581. In 1640 Portugal separates from the union with Spain. After two weeks of regency by a commission of governors, JoÃ£o III was installed as the first king of the House of BraganÃ§a. In blue the Regency during and shortly after the reign of Maria I. In 1807 the royal family fled during the Franco-Spanish Invasion, led by Junot who became Napoleon Bonaparte's vassal in Portugal. In 1808 the regency was led by Portuguese, until JoÃ£o VI returned from Brazil in 1821. 1580-1598 Filipe I 'el Prudente' (the Prudent), in Spain Felipe II, born on 21 May 1527 in Valladolid, Spain and died on 13 September 1598 in San Lorenzo de El Escorial, Spain, 71 years old. King:

17-07-1580 - 13-09-1598 1580-1583 AntÃ³nio I, prior van Crato, born in 1531 in Lisbon and died on 26 August 1595 in Paris, France, about 64 years old. King in dissidence against the Spanish Rule:

17-07-1580 - 11-08-1583 1598-1621 Filipe II 'el Piadoso' (the Pious), in Spain Felipe III, born on 14 April 1578 in Madrid, Spain and died on 31 March 1621 in Madrid, Spain, 42 years old. King:

13-09-1598 - 31-03-1621 1621-1640 Filipe III 'el Rey Planeta' (the Planet King), in Spain Felipe IV, born on 8 April 1605 in Valladolid, Spain and died on 17 September 1665 in Madrid, Spain, 60 years old. King:

31-03-1621 - 01-12-1640 Rodrigo da Cunha e da Silva, Archbishop of Lisbon, born in September 1577 in Lisbon and died on 3 January 1643 in Lisbon, 65 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

01-12-1640 - 15-12-1640 1640 SebastiÃ£o de Matos de Noronha, Archbishop of Braga, born on 21 December 1586 in Madrid, Spain and died in 1641 in Lisbon, about 54 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

01-12-1640 - 15-12-1640 LourenÃ§o de Lima Brito Nogueira, Viscount de Vila Nova de Cerveira, born about 1575/1578 and died about 1646, about 67 to 71 years old. Governor of the Kingdom:

01-12-1640 - 15-12-1640 1640-1656 JoÃ£o IV 'o Restaurador' (the Restorer), born on 18 March 1603 in Vila ViÃ§osa and died on 6 November 1656 in Lisbon, 53 years old. King:

15-12-1640 - 06-11-1656 1656 - 1683 Afonso VI 'o Vitorioso' (the Victorious), born on 21 August 1643 in Lisbon and died on 12 September 1683 in Sintra, 40 years old. King:

06-11-1656 - 12-09-1683 1656-1662 Luisa MarÃ­a Francisca de GuzmÃ¡n y Sandoval,born on 31 October 1613 in SanlÃºcar, Spain and died on 27 February 1666 in Lisbon, 52 years old. Regent for Afonso VI:

06-11-1656 - 23-06-1662 1667-1683

1683-1706 Pedro II 'o PacÃ­fico' (the Pacific), born on 26 April 1648 in Lisbon and died on 9 December 1706 in Sintra, 58 years old. Regent for Afonso VI:

23-11-1667 - 12-09-1683

King:

12-09-1683 - 09-12-1706 1706-1750 JoÃ£o V Francisco AntÃ³nio JosÃ© Bento Bernardo, 'o MagnÃ¢nimo' (the Magnanimous), born on 22 October 1689 in Lisbon and died on 31 July 1750 in Lisbon, 60 years old. King:

09-12-1706 - 31-07-1750 1750-1777 JosÃ© I Francisco AntÃ³nio IgnÃ¡cio Norberto Agostinho, 'o Reformador' (the Reformer), born on 6 June 1714 in Lisbon and died on 24 February 1777 in Lisbon, 62 years old. King:

31-07-1750 - 24-02-1777 1776-1777 Mariana Victoria de BorbÃ³n y Farnesio, born on 31 March 1718 in Madrid, Spain and died on 15 January 1781 in Lisbon, 62 years old. Regent for JosÃ© I:

29-11-1776 - 24-02-1777 1777-1816 Maria I Francisca Isabel Josefa AntÃ³nia Gertrudes Rita Joana, 'o Piedoso' (the Pious), born on 17 December 1734 in Lisbon and died on 20 March 1816 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 81 years old.

Queen (jointly with husband Pedro III):

24-02-1777 - 27-11-1807

Queen in exile in Brazil:

27-11-1807 - 20-03-1816 1777-1786 Pedro III Clemente Francisco JosÃ© AntÃ³nio, 'o Edificador' (the Builder), born on 5 July 1717 in Lisbon and died on 25 May 1786 in Queluz, 68 years old. Co-King (King consort of Maria I):

24-02-1777 - 25-05-1786 1799-1816

1816-1826 Prins JoÃ£o Maria JosÃ© Francisco Xavier de Paula LuÃ­s AntÃ³nio Domingos Rafaelde BraganÃ§a, since 1816 koning JoÃ£o VI 'o Clemente' (the Clement), born on 13 May 1767 in Lisbon and died on 10 March 1826 in Lisbon, 58 years old. Regent for Maria I:

15-07-1799 - 27-11-1807

Regent for Maria I in exile in Brazil:

27-11-1807 - 20-03-1816

King:

20-03-1816 - 10-03-1826

(Ruling from Brazil until 04-06-1821) 1807-1808 Pedro de Lencastre de Silveira Castelo Branco SÃ¡ de Meneses, Count de PortimÃ£o, Marquess de Abrantes, born on 28 July 1762 of 1771 in Lisbon and died on 25 March 1828, 56 of 65 years old. President of the Regency of the Kingdom:

27-11-1807 - 01-02-1808 1808 Jean-Andoche Junot, Duke de AbrantÃ¨s, born on 24 September 1771 in Bussy-le-Grand, France and died on 29 July 1813 in Montbard, France, 41 years old.

Military President of the Regency of the Kingdom:

01-02-1808 - 15-09-1808

(Agent executing French authority) 1808

1808-1814 AntÃ³nio de SÃ£o JosÃ© de Castro, Bishop of Porto, born in June 1741 in Lisbon and died on 12 April 1814 in Lisbon, 72 years old. President of the Provisional Government Junta of the Kingdom in opposition:

08-06-1808 - 15-09-1808

President of the Provisional Government Junta of the Kingdom:

15-09-1808 - 12-09-1814 1814-1817 Francisco de Melo da Cunha de MendonÃ§a e Meneses, Count de Castro Marim, Marquess de OlhÃ£o, born on 3 May 1760 or 26 April 1761 in Santa EngrÃ¡cia and died on 7 April 1821 in Beato, 59 or 60 years old. President of the Regency of the Kingdom:

12-09-1814 - 1817 1817-1820 Fernando Maria de Sousa Coutinho Castelo Branco e Meneses, Count de Redondo, Marquess de Borba, born on 25 October 1776 in Lisbon and died on 5 March 1834, 57 years old. President of the Regency of the Kingdom:

1817 - 15-09-1820 1820

1820 Antonio da Silveira Pinto da Fonseca Coelho, Viscount de Canelas, born on 1 May 1770 in Canelas and died on 18 October 1858 in Canelas, 88 years old.

Liberal Regent in Porto in rebellion:

24-08-1820 - 15-09-1820

President of the Provisional Government Junta of the Kingdom:

15-09-1820 - 01-10-1820 1820

1820-1821 Gomes Freire de Andrade e Forjaz, born in 1761 and died in 1831, about 70 years old.

Liberal President of the Interim Government:

27-09-1820 - 01-10-1820

President of the Provisional Government Junta of the Kingdom:

01-10-1820 - 30-01-1821 1821 Afonso Vasconcelos e Sousa da CÃ¢mara Caminha Faro e Veiga, Marquess de Castelo Melhor, born on 29 May 1783 in Lisbon and died on 27 August 1827, 44 years old.

Liberal President of the Regency Council:

30-01-1821 - 04-07-1821 1826 Pedro IV de AlcÃ¢ntara Francisco AntÃ³nio JoÃ£o Carlos Xavier de Paula Miguel Rafael Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Pascoal Cipriano Serafim, 'o Libertador' (the Liberator), born on 12 October 1798 in Lisbon and died on 24 September 1834 in Lisbon, 35 years old. King:

10-03-1826 - 02-05-1826 1826 Isabel Maria da ConÃ§eicÃ£o Joana Gualberta ana Francisca de Assis Xavier de Paula de AlcÃ¢ntara AntÃ³nia Rafaela Micaela Gabriela Joaquina Gonzaga de BraganÃ§a e Bourbon, born on 4 July 1801 in Lisbon and died on 22 April 1876 in Benfica, 74 years old. President of the Regency Council:

10-03-1826 - 02-05-1826 1826-1828 Maria II da GlÃ³ria Joana Carlota Leopoldina da Cruz Francisca Xavier de Paula Isidora Micaela Gabriela Rafaela Gonzaga, born on 4 April 1819 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and died on 15 November 1853 in Lisbon, 34 years old. Queen:

02-05-1826 - 07-07-1828 1826-1828 Isabel Maria da ConÃ§eicÃ£o Joana Gualberta ana Francisca de Assis Xavier de Paula de AlcÃ¢ntara AntÃ³nia Rafaela Micaela Gabriela Joaquina Gonzaga de BraganÃ§a e Bourbon, born on 4 July 1801 in Lisbon and died on 22 April 1876 in Benfica, 74 years old. President of the Regency Council:

02-05-1826 - 26-02-1828 1828 Pedro IV de AlcÃ¢ntara Francisco AntÃ³nio JoÃ£o Carlos Xavier de Paula Miguel Rafael Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Pascoal Cipriano Serafim, 'o Libertador' (the Liberator), born on 12 October 1798 in Lisbon and died on 24 September 1834 in Lisbon, 35 years old. Regent for Maria II:

26-02-1828 - 07-07-1828 1828 Miguel I Maria do PatrocÃ­nio JoÃ£o Carlos Francisco de Assis Xavier de Paula Pedro de AlcÃ¢ntara AntÃ³nio Rafael Gabriel Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Evaristo 'de Absolute Koning', born on 26 October 1802 in Lisbon and died on 14 November 1866 in Esselbach, Duitsland, 64 years old. Regent for Pedro IV:

26-02-1828 - 03-03-1828 1828 Duarte Guilherme Ferreri de GusmÃ£o, Baron de SÃ£o Martinho de Dume, born on 23 March 1778 and died on 10 April 1844, 66 years old.

Military Co-Regent as President of the Military Council:

19-05-1828 - 20-05-1828 1828 AntÃ³nio HipÃ³lito da Costa e Machado, Viscount de Alhos Vedros, born on 9 September 1758 in Moita and died on 27 April 1839, 80 years old.

Military Chairman of the Provisional Regency in exile on the Azores:

20-05-1828 - 01-07-1828 1828

1828-1834 Miguel I Maria do PatrocÃ­nio JoÃ£o Carlos Francisco de Assis Xavier de Paula Pedro de AlcÃ¢ntara AntÃ³nio Rafael Gabriel Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Evaristo, 'o Rei Absoluto' (the Absolute King), born on 26 October 1802 in Lisbon and died on 14 November 1866 in Esselbach, Germany, 64 years old. King:

07-07-1828 - 26-05-1834 1830-1834 Pedro IV de AlcÃ¢ntara Francisco AntÃ³nio JoÃ£o Carlos Xavier de Paula Miguel Rafael Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Pascoal Cipriano Serafim, 'o Libertador' (the Liberator), born on 12 October 1798 in Lisbon and died on 24 September 1834 in Lisbon, 35 years old. Regent for Miguel I:

15-03-1830 - 26-05-1834 1830-1832 Pedro de Sousa Holstein, Duke, Count and Marquess de Palmela, born on 8 May 1781 in Turin, Italy and died on 12 October 1850 in Lisbon, 69 years old.

Liberal President of the Regency Council in exile on the Azores:

15-03-1830 - 03-03-1832 1834-1853 Maria II da GlÃ³ria Joana Carlota Leopoldina da Cruz Francisca Xavier de Paula Isidora Micaela Gabriela Rafaela Gonzaga, born on 4 April 1819 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and died on 15 November 1853 in Lisbon, 34 years old. Queen:

26-05-1834 - 15-11-1853 1834 Pedro IV de AlcÃ¢ntara Francisco AntÃ³nio JoÃ£o Carlos Xavier de Paula Miguel Rafael Joaquim JosÃ© Gonzaga Pascoal Cipriano Serafim, 'o Libertador' (the Liberator), born on 12 October 1798 in Lisbon and died on 24 September 1834 in Lisbon, 35 years old. Regent for Maria I:

26-05-1834 - 20-09-1834 1853-1861 Pedro V de AlcÃ¢ntara Maria Fernando Miguel Rafael Gonzaga Xavier JoÃ£o AntÃ³nio Leopoldo VÃ­tor Francisco de Assis JÃºlio AmÃ©lio, 'o EsperanÃ§oso' (the Hopeful), born on 16 September 1837 in Lisbon and died on 11 November 1861 in Lisbon, 24 years old. King:

15-11-1853 - 11-11-1861 1853-1955 Fernando II, born Ferdinand August Franz Anton van Sachsen-Coburg und Gotha, born on 29 October 1816 in Vienna, Austria and died on 15 December 1885 in Lisbon, 69 years old. Regent for Pedro V (Titular King):

19-12-1853 - 16-09-1855 1861-1889 LuÃ­s I Filipe Maria Fernando Pedro de AlcÃ¢ntara AntÃ³nio Miguel Rafael Gabriel Gonzaga Xavier Francisco de Assis JoÃ£o Augusto JÃºlio Valfando, 'o Popular' (of the People), born on 31 October 1838 in Lisbon and died on 19 October 1889 in Cascais, 50 years old. King:

11-11-1861 - 19-10-1889 1889-1908 Carlos I Fernando LuÃ­s Maria Victor Miguel Rafael Gabriel Gonzaga Xavier Francisco de Assis JosÃ© SimÃ£o, 'o Diplomata' (the Diplomat), born on 28 September 1863 in Lisbon and died on 1 February 1908 in Lisbon, 44 years old. King:

19-10-1889 - 01-02-1908 1908-1910 Manuel II Maria Filipe Carlos AmÃ©lio LuÃ­s Miguel Rafael Gabriel Gonzaga Francisco de Assia Eugenio, 'o Patriota' (the Patriot), born on 19 March 1889 in Lisbon and died on 2 July 1932 in London, England, United Kingdom, 43 years old. King:

01-02-1908 - 05-10-1910

In 1910, after the 5 October Revolution, the kingdom is abolished and the country becomes a presidential republic.

The presidents of the First Republic: 1915-1917 Bernardino LuÃ­s Machado GuimarÃ£es, born on 28 March 1851 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and died on 29 April 1944 in Porto, 93 years old.

PRP President:

05-10-1915 - 11-12-1917 1917-1918 SidÃ³nio Bernardino Cardoso da Silva Pais, born on 1 May 1872 in Caminho and assassinated on 14 December 1918 in Lisbon, 46 years old.

Military, since 12 December 1917 PNR President of the Revolutionary Junta:

08-12-1917 - 11-12-1917:

Acting President:

11-12-1917 - 09-05-1918

President:

09-05-1918 - 14-12-1918 1918-1919 JoÃ£o do Canto e Castro da Silva Antunes JÃºnior, born on 19 May 1862 in Lisbon and died on 14 March 1934 in Lisbon, 71 years old.

PNR President:

15-12-1918 - 05-10-1919 1919 Henrique Mitchell de Paiva Cabral Couceiro, born on 30 December 1861 in Lisbon and died on 11 February 1944 in Lisbon, 82 years old.

Military/Monarchist President of the Provisional Junta of the Kingdom of Portugal in Porto and the North:

19-01-1919 - 13-02-1919

(In name of former king Manuel II) 1919-1923 AntÃ³nio JosÃ© de Almeida, born on 27 July 1866 in Penacova and died on 31 October 1929 in Lisbon, 63 years old.

PRE President:

05-10-1919 - 05-10-1923 1923-1925 Manuel Teixeira Gomes, born on 27 May 1860 in PortimÃ£o and died on 18 October 1941 in Bougie, Algeria, 81 years old.

PRP President:

05-10-1923 - 11-12-1925 1925-1926 Bernardino LuÃ­s Machado GuimarÃ£es, born on 28 March 1851 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and died on 29 April 1944 in Porto, 93 years old.

11-12-1925 - 31-05-1926

Military Acting President:

17-06-1926 - 09-07-1926 1926-1935 AntÃ³nio Ãscar Fragoso Carmona, born on 24 November 1869 in Lisbon and died on 18 April 1951 in Lisbon, 81 years old.

09-07-1926 - 15-04-1928

President:

15-04-1928 - 15-04-1935 1927 Adalbert GastÃ£o de Sousa Dias, born on 31 December 1865 in Chaves and died on 18 April 1951 in Lisbon, 85 years old.

03-02-1927 - 07-02-1927 1935 AntÃ³nio de Oliveira Salazar, born on 28 April 1889 in Vimieiro and died on 27 July 1970 in Lisbon, 81 years old.

18-04-1951 - 09-08-1951 1951-1958 Francisco Higino Craveiro Lopes, born on 12 April 1894 in Lisbon and died on 2 September 1964 in Lisbon, 70 years old.

UN President:

18-04-1951 - 09-08-1951 1958-1974 AmÃ©rico Deus Rodrigues ThomÃ¡s, born on 19 November 1894 in Lisbon and died on 18 September 1987 in Cascais, 92 years old.

18-04-1951 - 09-08-1951

The presidents of the Third Republic: 1974 AntÃ³nio SebastiÃ£o Ribeiro de SpÃ­nola, born on 11 April 1910 in Estremoz and died on 13 August 1996 in Lisbon, 86 years old.

09-03-2006 - 09-03-2016
